metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1781 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the gethostbyname_r and other unspecified NSS functions in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.22 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted DNS response, which triggers a call with a misaligned buffer. Arjun Shankar discovered that in certain situations the nss_dns code in the GNU C Library did not properly account buffer sizes when passed an unaligned buffer. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1781` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> only happens if gethostbyname_r etc functions are called with a misaligned buffer, which according to upstream in practice does not happen often

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
